intro: Thesium aphyllum, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a unique member of the Xanthorrhoeaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant is characterized by its pale green, leafless stems that appear almost translucent, giving it a ghostly appearance. It produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked. Despite its delicate appearance, Thesium aphyllum plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing shelter for small invertebrates.
